abstract.p: South Korea's largest construction company, Hyundai Engineering and Construction, is expected to give its creditor banks shares worth 340 billion won ($299.1 million) that it holds in other units of the Hyundai Group; shares will be given to creditor banks as collateral in exchange for short-term financing (S)

block.p: South Korea's largest construction company, Hyundai Engineering and Construction, is expected to give its creditor banks shares worth 340 billion won ($299.1 million) that it holds in other units of the Hyundai Group, the nation's largest conglomerate, the main creditor, Korea Exchange Bank, said. The shares will be given to the creditor banks as collateral in exchange for short-term financing, the bank said. Pledging to step up its downsizing efforts, Hyundai Group received a 50 billion won emergency loan on Friday from Korea Exchange Bank.
